name: YouTube Premiere
primary_goal_vibe: Create an event around a new video release with scheduled viewing, live chat, and anticipation.
tone_preference: Excited, clear, and value-focused. Combines the structure of long-form with the urgency of a live event.

copy_guidelines.copy_best_practices: The title and thumbnail must work like a strong long-form video hook. The description and promotional copy should emphasize the premiere time, why it is special, and what viewers gain by watching live. Include clear details and a main CTA to set reminders.
copy_guidelines.caption_structure_hint: Title: same as long-form, outcome-driven. Top of description: premiere date and time plus key benefit. Body: context, what the video covers, who it is for, and links. Final lines: CTA to set reminder, share, and watch live.
copy_guidelines.recommended_caption_length: Similar to long-form videos: 150–500 words if needed.
cta_examples: Set a reminder to join the premiere
Be there live and join the chat
Share this premiere with a friend
Watch live to ask questions in real time

on_screen_text_guidelines.primary_role: Promotional assets should highlight premiere date, time, and main hook.
best_practices: Add premiere time to overlays and posts when promoting
Keep on-screen text short and clear
Align the visual hook of the premiere with the long-form video content

hashtags_mentions.recommended_hashtags: 3–8 relevant hashtags in the description and any promotional community posts.
hashtags_mentions.hashtag_strategy: Use topic and series hashtags consistently across all premiere promotions.
hashtags_mentions.mention_strategy: Mention guests, collaborators, or sponsors in the description and in promotional content.

technical_constraints.premiere_setup_note: Video must be uploaded and scheduled as a premiere with date and time set in advance.
technical_constraints.live_chat_behavior: Live chat will be active during the premiere, then comments take over afterward.

required_elements: Clear premiere date and time in description
Main CTA to set a reminder and attend live
Description that clarifies what is special about the premiere
disallowed_practices: Scheduling premieres with vague or generic titles
Not mentioning the premiere time in copy
Treating a premiere like a normal upload with no event framing
Clickbait promises that the actual video does not deliver
